intro: Neuontobotrys choiquensis, commonly known as the Choique sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
